body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

It appears that using ```nullopt``` as a function arguments is not supported. It would be very helpful to allow this behavior to allow interfacing with libraries that have function and constructor arguments that use std::optional. 

For example the following code will not compile; giving the error: "Cannot assign type 'nullopt_t' to 'optional[double]'". 

```cython
%%cython --force -a
# distutils: language = c++
# distutils: extra_compile_args = /std:c++20

import numpy as np
cimport numpy as np
np.import_array()

from libcpp.vector cimport vector
from libcpp.optional cimport optional, nullopt

cdef extern from * nogil:
    """
    #include <iostream>
    #include <vector>
    #include <optional>
    void update_properties(std::optional<double> number)
    {
        if (number)
        {
            std::cout << "number was provided; It is " << number.value() << std::endl;
        }
        else
        {
            std::cout << "number was not provided." << std::endl;
        }
    }
    """
    void update_properties(optional[double] number)

cdef optional[double] test = 12
update_properties(test)
cdef optional[double] test2 = 0
update_properties(test2)

# Comment the line below to avoid the compile error.
update_properties(nullopt)
```


### Describe the solution you'd like.

The above code should compile and produce the output:
```
number was provided; It is 12
number was provided; It is 0
number was not provided.
```

### Describe alternatives you've considered.

_No response_

### Additional context

Tested with:
Cython version 3.0.12
Python 3.13.3
Windows 11

rename.from: [ENH] Support passing nullopt to wrapped functions what have std::optional arguments
rename.to: [ENH] Support passing nullopt to wrapped functions that have std::optional arguments

title: [ENH] Support passing nullopt to wrapped functions that have std::optional arguments
